page.title: 04ECOLOGY SCRAPTOFT THURNBY
page.content: Good views of the valley are obtained from Covert Lane and Uppingham Road.From the higher land in the east, one can see across the city of Leicester as far as Bradgate Park and Charnwood Forest, a hilly area formed of igneous rocks and amongst the oldest in the country.In the opposite direction,Billesdon Coplow can be seen.This well known landmark can be seen for miles around.This wooded hill is famous in hunting circles as it provides cover for many foxes.The Fernie,with whom Prince Charles often rides operate in ths area.The fields themselves form a pleasing view at different times of the year as crops ripen.A wide variety of colours including brown arable land,green pasture,yellow oil seed rape and the ripening corn, provide a pleasant picture throughout the year.
